name: Nakoma Dragon Golf Course
description: Nakoma offers an exceptional golf experience far from the crowded courses and wait times now the norm in Truckee-Tahoe. With picture-postcard views from every tee, Nakoma’s 18-hole championship course, the Dragon, never disappoints. Designed by Robin Nelson, creator of the famous Dunes at Mauna Lani, the Dragon debuted as one of America’s Top 75, according to Golf World.

faqs.question: What’s included in Nakoma Dragon golf group packages?
faqs.answer: Lodging, guaranteed tee times at The Dragon, carts, and concierge planning. Optional transportation, dining, and multi-course itineraries.

faqs.question: How much do Nakoma Dragon packages cost?
faqs.answer: Typical range is $199–$449 per golfer depending on season, lodging, and group size.

faqs.question: Do you handle corporate or tournament groups?
faqs.answer: Yes—room blocks, tee-time blocks, tournament setup, and logistics for corporate and leisure groups.

meta.title: Nakoma Dragon Golf Course | Graeagle Golf Groups & Stay and Play
meta.description: Plan The Dragon at Nakoma near Graeagle with golf groups, tee times, and stay-and-play packages. Expert planning for buddies, corporate, and leisure trips.

bodyText: Plan The Dragon at Nakoma near Graeagle with golf groups, tee times, and stay-and-play packages. Expert planning for buddies, corporate, and leisure trips.

THE DRAGON GOLF COURSE
Nakoma offers an exceptional golf experience far from the crowded courses and wait times now the norm in Truckee-Tahoe. With picture-postcard views from every tee, Nakoma’s 18-hole championship course, the Dragon, never disappoints. Designed by Robin Nelson, creator of the famous Dunes at Mauna Lani, the Dragon debuted as one of America’s Top 75, according to Golf World.

THE PROSHOP
Nakoma’s Pro Shop is located in the only golf clubhouse designed by Frank Lloyd Wright. From clubs, shoes, shirts and more, the Golf Shop features an extensive array of popular brands and accessories. You’ll find everything that suits your style, size and
interests.

The Dragon was designed by
Robin Nelson
, renowned for Hawaii’s Dunes at Mauna Lani, and has been recognized as one of America’s Top 75 courses by
Golf World
.

Nakoma’s clubhouse is the only
Frank Lloyd Wright–designed golf clubhouse
in the world, blending architectural history with modern golf amenities.

Nakoma offers a
less crowded, more secluded golf experience
with panoramic Sierra views and challenging elevation changes—making it a premium alternative to busy Tahoe-area courses.

Yes. Nakoma Resort offers on-site lodging, dining, and spa services, making it ideal for
stay-and-play golf getaways
.

Absolutely. Golf the High Sierra creates
custom stay-and-play packages
featuring Nakoma Dragon, nearby courses, and resort accommodations.
Request your package here »

tips.title: THE PROSHOP
tips.content:
Nakoma’s Pro Shop is located in the only golf clubhouse designed by Frank Lloyd Wright. From clubs, shoes, shirts and more, the Golf Shop features an extensive array of popular brands and accessories. You’ll find everything that suits your style, size and
interests.

tips.title: What makes Nakoma’s clubhouse unique?
tips.content:
Nakoma’s clubhouse is the only
Frank Lloyd Wright–designed golf clubhouse
in the world, blending architectural history with modern golf amenities.

tips.title: Is lodging available at Nakoma?
tips.content:
Yes. Nakoma Resort offers on-site lodging, dining, and spa services, making it ideal for
stay-and-play golf getaways
.

tips.title: Golf The High Sierra
tips.content: Book your next group golf trip with us!

contentParagraphs: Plan The Dragon at Nakoma near Graeagle with golf groups, tee times, and stay-and-play packages. Expert planning for buddies, corporate, and leisure trips.

Nakoma’s Pro Shop is located in the only golf clubhouse designed by Frank Lloyd Wright. From clubs, shoes, shirts and more, the Golf Shop features an extensive array of popular brands and accessories. You’ll find everything that suits your style, size and interests.
The Dragon was designed by Robin Nelson , renowned for Hawaii’s Dunes at Mauna Lani, and has been recognized as one of America’s Top 75 courses by Golf World .
Nakoma’s clubhouse is the only Frank Lloyd Wright–designed golf clubhouse in the world, blending architectural history with modern golf amenities.
Nakoma offers a less crowded, more secluded golf experience with panoramic Sierra views and challenging elevation changes—making it a premium alternative to busy Tahoe-area courses.

featuredHole.title: Hole #14 — Par 4
featuredHole.description: The signature hole at Nakoma's Dragon Course plays across a dramatic canyon perched above the Feather River valley. An elevated tee offers panoramic views of the Lost Sierra, with the downhill approach requiring a precise iron to a well-guarded green.

testimonials.quote: Nakoma Dragon Golf Course was the highlight of our Graeagle, CA golf trip. Fairways were immaculate, pace of play was great, and the staff treated our group like VIPs. Golf the High Sierra nailed the tee time spacing for us.
testimonials.author: Carol D.

testimonials.quote: We drove up from the Bay Area specifically to play Nakoma Dragon Golf Course. Absolutely worth it. The Graeagle, CA mountain backdrop on every hole is something special. GTHS arranged preferred tee times that worked perfectly for our group.
testimonials.author: Brandon K.

testimonials.quote: First time playing Nakoma Dragon Golf Course and it exceeded every expectation. The scenery alone is worth the trip, but the course layout is genuinely challenging and fair. Our whole group wants to come back.
testimonials.author: Emily T.
